intro: Litsea amaroideocarpa, commonly known as the bitter fruit litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is typically small, woody, and contains several seeds. The botanical features of Litsea amaroideocarpa make it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
